Apa Ada Korban Spyware Israel di Indonesia? Ini Jawab Menkominfo
07 Nov 2019, 16:19 by Adi Fida Rahman - detikInet


WhatsApp. Foto: Adi Fida Rahman/detikINET

Jakarta - Menteri Komunikasi dan Informatika (Menkominfo) Johnny G Plate memastikan tidak ada korban serangan spyware Pegasus di Indonesia. Spyware atau software mata-mata buatan perusahaan asal Israel, NSO Group itu menyasar WhatsApp untuk mencuri data."Not yet. Tidak ada impact. Untungnya di Indonesia tidak ada," tegasnya saat konferensi pers pertemuannya dengan pihak Facebook dan WhatsApp di Kantor Kominfo, Kamis (7/11/2019).Johnny mengatakan, pihaknya telah melakukan pemonitoran. Sejauh ini, hasilnya tidak ditemukan korban dan dampak Spyware Pegasus di Tanah Air. Pun begitu, pihaknya tetap melakukan monitoring bersama Badan Siber dan Sandi Negara (BSSN).Dalam kesempatan ini, Johnny mengajak dan meminta masyarakat untuk mengupdate aplikasi sesuai saran pembuatnya. Cara ini diyakininya dapat mencegah serangan spyware maupun malware"Kalau mereka bilang tolong ini di-update software, jadi update itu. Karena dengan update mencegah semua spyware atau malware apapun namanya yang mengacaukan itu, seperti Pegasus," ajaknya. Are There Victims of Spyware Israel in Indonesia? This is the Minister of Communication and Information replied
Nov 7 2019, 16:19 by Adi Fida Rahman - detikInet


WhatsApp. Photo: Adi Fida Rahman / detikINET

Jakarta - Minister of Communication and Information (Menkominfo) Johnny G Plate ensures there are no victims of the Pegasus spyware attack in Indonesia. Spyware or spy software made by an Israeli company, NSO Group is targeting WhatsApp to steal data. "Not yet. There is no impact. Fortunately in Indonesia there is no," he said during a press conference meeting with Facebook and WhatsApp at the Office of Communication and Information, Thursday (7/11/2019). Johnny said, his party had conducted monitoring. So far, the results are not found victims and the impact of Pegasus Spyware in the country. Even so, it continues to conduct monitoring with the National Siber and State Code Agency (BSSN). On this occasion, Johnny invited and asked the public to update the application according to the manufacturer's suggestion. He believes this method can prevent spyware or malware attacks "If they say please update the software, so update it. Because the update prevents all spyware or malware whatever the name is messing with, like Pegasus," he said.
